title: Extra Learners For mlr3
Extra Learners For mlr3
text: mlr3extralearners contains learners mlr3 mlr3learners core packages. mlr3extralearners contains helper functions find learners, across mlr3verse, live install required packages run learners. See interactive learner list full list learners mlr3verse learner status page respective upstream packages CRAN status. mlr3extralearners lives GitHub CRAN. Install :
code: list_mlr3learners(select = c("id", "mlr3_package", "required_packages")) #>                      id      mlr3_package      required_packages #>   1: classif.AdaBoostM1 mlr3extralearners                  RWeka #>   2:       classif.bart mlr3extralearners                 dbarts #>   3:        classif.C50 mlr3extralearners                    C50 #>   4:   classif.catboost mlr3extralearners               catboost #>   5:    classif.cforest mlr3extralearners partykit,sandwich,coin #>  ---                                                             #> 128:        surv.ranger      mlr3learners                 ranger #> 129:         surv.rfsrc mlr3extralearners randomForestSRC,pracma #> 130:         surv.rpart         mlr3proba  rpart,distr6,survival #> 131:           surv.svm mlr3extralearners            survivalsvm #> 132:       surv.xgboost      mlr3learners                xgboost remotes::install_github("mlr-org/mlr3extralearners")

title: Extra Learners For mlr3
text: package includes functionality detecting required packages installed use learner, ships function install_learner can install required learner dependencies.
code: lrn("regr.gbm") #> Error: Required packages not installed, please run `install_learners("regr.gbm")`. install_learners("regr.gbm") lrn("regr.gbm") #> <LearnerRegrGBM:regr.gbm> #> * Model: - #> * Parameters: keep.data=FALSE, n.cores=1 #> * Packages: gbm #> * Predict Type: response #> * Feature types: integer, numeric, factor, ordered #> * Properties: importance, missings, weights

title: Extra Learners For mlr3
text: New learners can created create_learner function. assumes local copy mlr3extralearners. function automatically create learner, learner tests, parameter tests, YAML files CI required, update DESCRIPTION required. tests passing locally, open pull request “New Learner” template.
code: create_learner(classname = "Locfit",                algorithm = "localised fit",                type = "dens",                key = "locfit",                package = "locfit",                caller = "density.lf",                feature_types = c("integer", "numeric"),                predict_types = c("pdf", "cdf"),                properties = NULL,                importance = FALSE,                oob_error = FALSE,                references = FALSE,                gh_name = "RaphaelS1")

title: New Learner

title: Create a New Learner — create_learner
text: Helper function generate required files, fill fields, new learners.

title: Create a New Learner — create_learner
code: create_learner(   pkg = ".",   classname,   algorithm,   type,   key = tolower(classname),   package = tolower(classname),   caller,   feature_types,   predict_types,   properties = NULL,   references = FALSE,   gh_name )

title: Create a New Learner — create_learner
text: pkg character(1)  Path mlr3extralearners package. classname character(1)  Suffix R6 class name passed LearnerTypeclassname. algorithm character(1)  Brief description algorithm documentation title. type character(1)  See mlr3::mlr_reflections$task_types$type. key character(1)  id learner, provided defaults classname lower case. package character(1)  Package learner implemented, defaults classname lower case. caller character(1)  Training function called implemented package. feature_types character()  Feature types can handled learner, see mlr3::mlr_reflections$task_feature_types. predict_types character()  Prediction types can made learner, see mlr3::mlr_reflections$learner_predict_types. properties character()  Properties can handled learner, see mlr3::mlr_reflections$learner_properties. references logical(1)  Set TRUE want add references learner. gh_name character(1)  GitHub handle, used add maintainer learner.

title: Create a New Learner — create_learner
text: function following: Creates learner_package_type_key.R file implemented learner. Creates test_package_type_key.R file unit testing learner. Creates test_paramtest_package_type_key.R file testing correct implementation learner parameters. Creates test_package.yml file running unit tests GitHub actions Automatically completes test (2), yaml files (4) Automatically adds learner package DESCRIPTION file learner file fields automatically filled methods must manually added along parameter set, clearly marked files. create learner must follow steps: Run function many arguments possible Manually add .train, .predict private methods learner, well adding param_set possibly param_vals. properties include "oob_error" /"importance" add public methods manually. Check paramtests unit tests pass locally. Run devtools::document(roclets = c('rd', 'collate', 'namespace')) styler::style_pkg(style = styler::mlr_style) (may need first run remotes::) usethis::use_tidy_description() lintr::lint_package() Open pull request https://github.com/mlr-org/mlr3extralearners/pulls new learner template.

text: version (character(1)) Version install, NULL installs latest os (character(1))  Operating system install , NULL automatically detected install_required (logical(1))  TRUE (default) installs required packages: curl, jsonlite, devtools INSTALL_opts (character())  Passed devtools::install_url ...  arguments passed devtools::install_url

text: Type SVC depends type argument: 0 – L2-regularized logistic regression (primal) 1 - L2-regularized L2-loss support vector classification (dual) 3 - L2-regularized L1-loss support vector classification (dual) 2 – L2-regularized L2-loss support vector classification (primal) 4 – Support vector classification Crammer Singer 5 - L1-regularized L2-loss support vector classification 6 - L1-regularized logistic regression 7 - L2-regularized logistic regression (dual) number records > number features, type = 2 faster type = 1 (Hsu et al. 2003). Note probabilistic predictions available types 0, 6, 7. default epsilon value depends type parameter, see LiblineaR::LiblineaR.

title: Survival Fully Parametric Learner — mlr_learners_surv.parametric
Survival Fully Parametric Learner — mlr_learners_surv.parametric
text: learner allows choose distribution model form compose predicted survival probability distribution. internal predict method implemented package implementation efficient composition distributions survival::predict.survreg(). lp predicted using formula \(lp = X\beta\) \(X\) variables test data set \(\beta\) fitted coefficients. distribution distr composed using lp specifying model form type hyper-parameter. follows, respective survival functions, Accelerated Failure Time (aft) $$S(t) = S_0(\frac{t}{exp(lp)})$$ Proportional Hazards (ph) $$S(t) = S_0(t)^{exp(lp)}$$ Proportional Odds (po) $$S(t) = \frac{S_0(t)}{exp(-lp) + (1-exp(-lp)) S_0(t)}$$ Tobit (tobit) $$S(t) = 1 - F((t - lp)/s)$$ \(S_0\) estimated baseline survival distribution (case given parametric form), \(lp\) predicted linear predictor, \(F\) cdf N(0, 1) distribution, \(s\) fitted scale parameter. Whilst combination distribution model form possible, mean necessarily create sensible interpretable prediction. following combinations 'sensible': dist = "gaussian"; type = "tobit"; dist = "weibull"; type = "ph"; dist = "exponential"; type = "ph"; dist = "weibull"; type = "aft"; dist = "exponential"; type = "aft"; dist = "loglogistic"; type = "aft"; dist = "lognormal"; type = "aft"; dist = "loglogistic"; type = "po";
